asset.name: EDG-7500
asset.one_liner: EDG-7500 is a novel selective oral cardiac sarcomere modulator in Phase 2 for obstructive and nonobstructive hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, with Phase 3 initiation targeted H2 2026.

biology.simple_explanation: In HCM, the heart muscle is abnormally thick and stiff, making it harder for the heart to pump blood. EDG-7500 modulates the cardiac sarcomere to slow the early velocity of contraction, improving the heart's ability to relax and fill with blood.

why_good_target.clinical_validation: CIRRUS-HCM Parts B/C showed improvements in NT-proBNP, KCCQ, NYHA class, and LVOT gradient; no clinically meaningful LVEF declines

mechanism.how_it_works: Slows early contraction velocity of cardiac muscle to improve diastolic function in HCM
mechanism.differentiation: Selective oral cardiac sarcomere modulator; potential for both obstructive and nonobstructive HCM (nHCM has no approved therapies)

dose_response.dose_rationale: Parts B/C evaluated fixed dose cohorts; Part D evaluating optimized dosing

pharmacology.pk_summary: Oral small molecule. 25mg, 50mg, 100mg doses tested in CIRRUS-HCM Parts B/C. ~70% of Part D participants reached >=100mg dose level.

lead.name: Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM) — obstructive and nonobstructive
lead.current_penetration: oHCM: mavacamten (Camzyos) and aficamten approved; nHCM: no approved targeted therapies
lead.rationale: Nonobstructive HCM has no approved targeted therapies; EDG-7500 may address both subtypes

trials.name: CIRRUS-HCM Phase 2
trials.status: Parts B/C completed; Part D ongoing, full readout expected 2Q 2026
trials.design: Multi-part dose-ranging study in oHCM and nHCM
trials.enrollment: Parts B/C: 43 participants across 25mg, 50mg, 100mg; Part D: >40 enrolled, 20 completed 12 weeks (8 oHCM, 12 nHCM) as of Dec 23, 2025 cutoff

primary_endpoint.result: Parts B/C: Improvements in NT-proBNP, KCCQ, NYHA class, and LVOT gradient (oHCM). Part D: No clinically meaningful LVEF declines; no LVEF <50% observed.

biomarkers.name: NT-proBNP
biomarkers.result: Improvements observed in Parts B/C at 50mg and 100mg
biomarkers.clinical_significance: Cardiac stress biomarker; reduction indicates improved cardiac function

biomarkers.name: LVOT gradient
biomarkers.clinical_significance: Reduction of obstruction in obstructive HCM

safety.summary: Generally well tolerated. >300 ambulatory monitors captured >2,600 patient-days with no AF/flutter detected during monitoring. One AF event reported in Part D deemed not related to study drug by investigator.

differentiation_claims.claim: Potential for both obstructive and nonobstructive HCM (nHCM has no approved targeted therapies)
differentiation_claims.caveat: Phase 2 data only; Part D full readout pending

competitors.limitation: Approved for oHCM only; REMS program required
competitors.differentiation_vs_us: EDG-7500 targeting both oHCM and nHCM

market_opportunity.unmet_need: Nonobstructive HCM has no approved targeted therapies

catalysts.event: CIRRUS-HCM Part D 12-week full data readout
catalysts.what_to_watch: Full efficacy in oHCM and nHCM; cardiac safety (AF monitoring)
catalysts.bull_scenario: Strong efficacy in both oHCM and nHCM with clean safety supports Phase 3
catalysts.bear_scenario: Safety signals or insufficient efficacy in nHCM

catalysts.event: Phase 3 initiation in oHCM and nHCM
catalysts.bull_scenario: Broad HCM program including nHCM differentiates from competition
catalysts.bear_scenario: Competitive landscape with mavacamten and aficamten already approved

key_risks: One AF event in Part D — cardiac safety scrutiny
Phase 2 data only; Phase 3 not yet started

bull_case.thesis: nHCM has no approved therapies — large unaddressed market
bull_case.evidence: Part D enrolling both oHCM and nHCM patients

bear_case.thesis: Late entrant in HCM with two approved competitors

recommended_supplementary_sources: CIRRUS-HCM Part D full publication (expected H1 2026)
